alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 7:01PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is ongoing. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM MST, stream gauges continue to report high flows along Dry and Wet Beaver Creeks. Minor flooding is occurring in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Long Canyon, Jacks Canyon, Verde River, Beaver Creek, Rarick Canyon, Russell Wash, West Clear Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, Dry Beaver Creek, Walker Creek and Oak Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Village At Oak Creek, V Bar V Visitors Center, Wet Beaver Creek Campground and Clear Creek Campgrounds. - This includes the following swimming holes... Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area, Bell Crossing "The Crack", Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground and Indian Maiden Falls. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 223 and 227...and near mile marker 229. Interstate 17 between mile markers 291 and 306. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 307. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
